column4: why? if someone likes and knows k3b, why should we deliberately steer them away from it?
would you recommend Nero on linux using wine? no... same thing, both will run, neither will work...
oh is the k3b package actually broken then? fair enough
its not supported, and the kde debian guys are here, so there not paying much attention to it really... 400+ kde bugs right now...
would you use a product that the maintainers don't even care about?
I'm not sure what that's got to do with anything.
why would you install buggy software?
there is no software that isn't buggy.
I'm saying the Debian packages of KDE are badly maintained... 400+ bugs is rediculous...
in comparison, gnome has about 40.
you probably have universe at least  :/
yes...
I haven't been paying attention to him...
oh, how helpful of you to comment despite that.
he would get errors if the dir didn't exist... he's not complaining of this...
I thought you weren't paying attention...
just noticed that, even less reason as to why he can't find it  :/
wow. you're a longterm debian user, right?
3+ years, yeah
that explains the abrasiveness then ;)
hah, I suppose... frustrates me to see people not getting it  :(
hopefully you're kidding... but its an Integrated Developement Environment... basically a GUI meant to simplify programming  :)
oh, yet another IDE
